intro: Ellipinema jakonense, commonly known as the Java ellipinema, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
